place_description: Local bakery chain serving Charlotte and nearby neighborhoods since 2009. Fresh from scratch pastries, breads, coffee, sandwiches, and more. Whether you are looking for a quiet place to work and get fast free WiFi, or need to place a large catering order, our bakery can't be beat. Looking for lunch? We serve fresh made sandwiches every day of the week. Visit us on East 7th Street today, or shop online and ship fresh baked goods nationwide.

reviews_data.review_text: Delicious BAKERY
Edit 7/24/2024 - service has gone down a little but still better than the Harrisburg location.

Have visited many times and enjoyed lots of their offerings! Their biscuit breakfast sandwiches are enormous and delicious. The chocolate chip cookies are so very good. English muffins are a nice change from your regular store bought versions, obviously much more artisanal. Key lime pie was yummy...sandwiches are solid as well. Honestly, I have tried a lot from here and absolutely no complaints. Staff is always really pleasant. Very much appreciate this business in the neighborhood!
Great coffee, wish they gave me a cupcake that wasn't frozen tho
Wasn't greeted upon entering, however partner was given a cheesecake instead of an exchange & it happen to be his birthday

Handicapped  parking is a normal sized spot and in the middle of the parking lot. Not sure how I'm expected to get my wheelchair out. I know it's not their fault, but they need to pressure the property owner to get the parking spots fixed. Not cool.

I called for a last minute gender reveal cupcake if I were to bring the results by in an envelope.  They were so accommodating within a few hours. The results were an amazing surprise and the cupcake was delicious. Highly recommend! Thank you so much.

The pastries are amazing, of course. But I have to say the service was incredibly awful. They tell you five minutes for cinnamon rolls and then 35 minutes and you have to remind them that they still have outstanding orders of people sitting there waiting patiently it ruins the experience.
We loved their muffins and other pastries. Friendly staff as well!
The food is good, atmosphere is very chic, but we waited for two coffees for an hour while people behind us were served and left. Come for the food, but not the drinks!
Usually purchase items & leave. The cheddar biscuits & morning glory muffins are to die for!!
Beware the vegan gluten free muffin. Delicious, but NOT gluten free!
Love everything especially their breakfast burrito and any sandwich on a cheddar biscuit
their baked goods are hit or miss on freshness. seems understaffed. I go here specifically for the gluten free baked goods but have enjoyed other gf bakeries in the area more
I love this cute breakfast place. They bake their own bread

It's a decent coffee place with good food and pastries but the service can be lacking. They really struggle during rush hours. I've seen people leave the line because of how slow they operate during rush hours
I love it , kept the old tradition that was 7 years ago and now the can not expect your hard cash money

Went in on a Friday morning and the woman behind the counter was rude while taking our order. Then it took about 20 minutes to receive a breakfast sandwhich that was well below average quality. I would not go back here.
The customer service here is very underwhelming. Customer satisfaction can make or break your business.  This place won't last long. 1 star
They treated my friend very poorly and it changed the atmosphere of the establishment .

The service here is EXTREMELY POOR with VERY INCONSIDERATE employees! They do not deserve any stars AT ALL and they also need a complete overhaul of ALL of the staff members including the Manager. Waited 30 minutes to get my order, then the order was wrong and when I notified the employee that I've been waiting for a long period of time and that the sandwich was wrong she was very rude and very disrespectful. Subsequently I received my order after ANOTHER 20 minutes and the order was arranged very sloppily and also the ingredients mashed together as if done purposely by those irresponsible employees, to signal their discontent with having to serve me. DO NOT go to this restaurant and patronize this establishment. IT'S NOT WORTH IT!!

A few friends visited this location over the weekend we placed an order and 5 people behind us were served after i already placed my order, we sat down and patiently waited for my order to be remade.
20 minutes later I went back up to the counter and asked about the order.
She said that I never asked them to remake it and she was so damn rude and nasty to me.  I really had to practice composure. It was the nasty attitude that really pissed me off and the fact that I waited extra long the first time, the order was wrong, and after waiting for them to remake it they never did. I waited for another 20 minutes for them to finally remake my order, and when I got it it was of poor quality. It seems like someone purposely crunched up the bacon in pieces.
That was so unnecessary. I was very upset with the service and behavior of the staff.

If I could leave 0 stars I would because there's no excuse for the targeted and intentional lack of  service I was given. I placed a simple order and noticed 5 people who ordered after me got their orders first. No biggie. I finally got my food and noticed my order was wrong and normally I would just deal with it but I have a food allergy that prevented that this time. But ok, accidents happen. I went back to the counter and asked for it to be remade. After waiting another 20 mins I went to check on it and with a scathing, rude and frustrated attitude I was basically scolded and told I never asked them to remake anything. At this point I had to hold back showing my own discontent because I was never impolite, my order was small and simple, and the mistakes were at MY expense, not theirs. Anyway after ANOTHER 20 mins I finally get my stupid bacon and egg sandwich with NO cheese and it appeared slapped together. Literally. Like someone angrily smashed it or sat on it. Bacon crunched up everywhere. That was the last straw. I will NEVER be back and it would warm my heart if this helped anyone else reconsider doing ANY business here.

This place have some workers with very bad attitudes.   Some things are not caused for.  My daughter was treated very poorly by one of the employees and it was totally unacceptable.   Your employers must do better.  If they don't know how to treat the customers right, they shouldn't be in customer service.  Maybe HR needs to do a retraining on how to treat people.   Do BETTER!!!!

A close family member was treated unfairly and the staff member was very rude to her . After her order was done incorrectly she nicely asked could they correct her order and after a long wait the order was still not acceptable. The bacon was crushed like it was purposely done and the staff member still was very rude. This is unacceptable to anyone . Do not eat here unless you want rude  service!!!

A close family member of mine had the WORST experience here. DO NOT EAT HERE!!!! The cashier was very rude and nasty to her and also 5 other parties who came AFTER her received their to go orders before her. SAVE YOUR MONEY EAT SOMEWHERE ELSE!

Placed order online as was looking for something specific and drove from south carolina to pick it up only to know that they dont have what I ordered and they replaced the item without consent with a rude/arrogant employee. They say that online orders are via a third party called chownow, so they cant even refund for the original item that was paid for. Not coming back to this location.

WORST SUNFLOUR BAKERY IN THE AREA.
Will never visit the 7th street location..terrible experience..be careful placing an online order ..because u might not get what u order plus no refunds and no politeness...

I did a door dash order then got a call 15 minutes later from the driver telling  me they didn't have 75% of the items! Why was i able to order these items at all?! don't know why I keep coming back here, I had a decent chocolate chip cookie here 10 years ago so I suppose I hoped things would eventually get better. Do not eat here period! this location needs to shut down.

There are a few of these locations in the Charlotte area -- while it is great to have a bakery / coffee option, the quality of the gluten-free baked goods can be hit or miss and I am not always sure that the team uses precautions when handling the gf options. Also, the Elizabeth location often seems to struggle with team support -- definitely avoid this location if you're in a hurry in the morning. The line is inevitable and it does not usually move quickly.

Place is super cute!! Like the decorations, music, and the way the pastries are displayed. I got a carrot muffin and a dirty mocha. Muffin is delicious, but the coffee was less mocha than I expected, but still good!  The man that took my order wasn't very nice, as he didn't even greet me, answer when I said thank you, and just sort of ignored me. They seemed a bit busy, so I can understand a bit. When I got to my table, the seat was covered in crumbs. Not a big deal to me personally, but could be to some people. Overall, food and atmosphere was great! But customer service and cleanliness was debatable, so maybe I'll try another location!

Really lovely experience in this cafe.

Nice selection of food and drinks. Always top quality food and friendly service. Wen we visit Charlotte, popping into Sunshine is a must.

This visit we had the avocado sandwich , super tasty.
The food was good, the counter we sat at was so filthy everything was sticking to it, the service was phenomenal!!

Always amazing, delicious, fresh and unique flavors. Such great food!! Service is always excellent too. And the atmosphere is great. Very clean, with nice background music at a good volume for conversation, reading, etc.
Excellent breakfast menu and cool laid back atmosphere.. great service and friendly staff..

Yall are using that goofy bacon you cook in the microwave.  Come on now, thats fine if you're cooking breakfast for an army of rats but if you got folks paying 10 bucks for a breakfast sandwich - you can give us legit bacon.

Ordered the Tab and had multiple chunks of avocado with the skin still on it. Doesn't appear to be sanitary either, I could see thick buildup on their milk steamer wand. Cross-contamination   of dairy-free and regular milk. I would not recommend this cafe. I also asked a worker if they make their "fresh" baked goods in-house and she confessed that all of their cookies and muffins aren't even made in that location.
Terrible demeanor of staff, totally disorganized. Food good.
Didn't expect a mouthful of grounds in a $4 cup of coffee. Because, I don't reside in Charlotte it must be a local thing?
I'm no soup connoisseur, but when I ask for your soup it should actually have more broth than dumping a bunch of ham with very little potato in the ham/potato soup.

I hate doing this because I absolutely love all of the pastries here but after my experience today this review is absolutely deserved. I entered the Ballantyne location at 3:00 this afternoon (knowing that they close at 4:00) only to be (literally) escorted out being told that they would be closing early at 3:00 and they had just shut down the registers. I begged them....saying that I only wanted one thing and that I had driven from the other side of town!! I told them that I would overpay in cash and that they could keep the change as a tip and they refused!!! I own two businesses and this is just disgusting behavior! I tell SO many people about this place and its just incredibly disappointing that this happened. There have also been a couple of other sketchy things that occurred with past orders/experiences there but I don't like to leave negative reviews....just can't ignore this!!

Things have been a little dicey here lately. Our burritos were just ok, our iced lattes had chunks in them and weren't stirred...(super not cool)... and the peeps are just put out and can't be bothered to help.
I asked for a BLT to go they gave me an egg sandwich, I also ordered the tiramisu and key lime pie both tasted off really nasty to tell you the truth.
9/17/23 8.00am Cashier you have to listen to the orders. I ordered 2 cheese biscuits with ham.l got 2 burned cheese biscuits with cheese.Too much money and recieved wrong order.

By far one of the absolute WORST breakfast Ever! Absolutely would NOT recommend...
Just Don't bother...
Love their food.

I went to Sunflour for brunch today with my son.  We ordered a raspberry danish, a banana chocolate chip muffin, an egg sandwich and an avocado melt.  Everything was sooooo delicious!!  I had planned to save the avocado melt for a late lunch but after devouring the raspberry danish I just HAD to try the sandwich.  I ate half the sandwich, stared at the 2nd half for a moment, then gave in and ate it ALL.  I went in hungry and left STUFFED!  My son ate every bite of his meal as well.  While we were there I was impressed by how hard working the staff was.  They greeted everyone with a smile (even customers who took too long to order which is totally understandable with so many options to choose from!) and made sure the tables were wiped down and the seating area was clean.  The restrooms in the back were also clean and well stocked.  Mostly I enjoyed watching so many couples and families sit down and relax in this little gem of a restaurant.  I overheard one lady tell her husband they only had 5 minutes before they had to leave but they still enjoyed the break from the normal chaos of life to sit down, sip their coffee and enjoy their pastry.  We will definitely be back to do the same.

Good food. Long wait on food.
There were 2 new guys working and the woman  who was training them clearly isn't made for training and managing people. She was way too stressed and made the place feel less comfortable.
The new guys were doing well!

Ordered birthday cupcakes there and they did not follow my direction's!!! on what I wanted!!! and they had a sticker on the box with the directions written right on it. I don't understand smh. had to ask them to put sprinkles on it and they were stingy with that. Never will order from this location again.
Good for vegan lovers

A cafe that i have enjoyed many times in the past, sadly has gone down hill in terms of service since before COVID. I have been here multiple times prior to writing this review and each time, I feel the service gets worse, thus prompting me to write this review. I rarely write a mediocre review but I have been inspired. Multiple orders have been messed up, which is no big deal but the approach to recovery fails each time. Employees in general don't seem to want to be there... I hope Sunflour is isn't providing a bad work environment.

Also, longer offering drinks in real mugs. I find this a waste if I'm eating in.

If "ok boomer" was a restaurant. Ate in. Order was wrong. First staff argued about who was in error. When the order was taken back thry said they would scrape off the wrong condiments.  When told this was unacceptable the staff was at the kitchen window and laughed,  and someone said " haha, oh we know how to handle this...." having worked in a kitchen this means adulterated food... usually spitting in it.  I asked for a refund for that item the manager printed another copy of the receipt.  Not a refund. I pointed this out and she got mad. I asked for contact information for owners  (Mr Parrish) and was refused. It comes across as the kind of place that spits in the coffee of police. Simply put, health department should come in for an audit. Cleanliness was fair. Staff doesn't want to be there and the owner doesn't seem to care. The other locations might be better, but this one is horrible.  This decline has taken place over a year. It was good a year ago, then items would be missing or wrong in pick up orders,  then dirty facilities,  no napkins,  owner was reached out to through another location and no response.  If you look at recent reviews this is the trend for this location. Waffle House at 3 am is cleaner and more reliable.
Got 3 different croissants. All were delicious.

I was referred to this place by a family member. They always get great cakes. I ordered a vanilla birthday cake with buttercream icing and swirls. As the employee was finishing my prepaid order she asked another coworker about the order. This coworker told her birthday cakes were a classic order. (I didn't know what that was). I was told I could pick up my cake on Friday morning. The order was put in on Thursday morning. When I called on Friday morning I was told the cake would not be ready until Saturday morning. This was okay because the celebration was sat evening. Well I was called saturday morning to be asked what type icing I wanted on the cake. Because I was working I did not get the message until late. Well when I picked up my order it was a chocolate cake with chocolate layer icing. I was told that classic birthday cakes come chocolate made. It was not what I ordered. So my first experience ordering from this company was bad. It's also to far to drive to and not get what you ordered. I'll be sticking to what works, getting my cakes from Sam's Club.
I love going here. The staff is wonderful and always friendly.

The portions are a very VERY generous.  The place wasn't as clean as i would prefer an eating establishment to be but the food truly is extraordinarily good. The croissants are enormous, the orange poppy seed was really good but the vanilla one takes the cake.

Had high hopes for the treats here. The staff was nice, shop was clean, and coffee was good. But...the sweets I had were just too sour and tart. The different  cupcakes, cream puffs, and muffins all had the same strong sour taste like extra lemon juice, or strong lemon base was added to everything I ordered. Multiple items were very sour and tasted off. It would be good to maybe mention this on a sign for the customer if the normal flavor profile for the bakery items are extra sour.

I only go to this place when absolutely needed. Every single time they get it wrong, this time they forgot the sausage, last time they put peanut butter in my breakfast sandwiches. I do not understand what goes on in this place but they need to fix it. Sad to see that I spent more money on sausage and avocado to get home and find no sausage and moldy avocado.

The breads and pastries that Sunflour Baking Company on 7th Street offered impressed me when I went there for breakfast. Both the cappuccino and the croissant sandwich with ham and cheese that I ordered were excellent. The cappuccino was smooth and creamy, and the croissant was flaky and delicious. The location was tidy and comfortable, and the staff was kind and helpful. The fact that they were out of several products when I arrived and I really wanted to taste their cinnamon rolls is the only reason I didn't give them a perfect score of five stars. Possibly next time. This bakery is a must-try for anyone seeking a filling and healthy breakfast, in my opinion.

I've always loved this location, it was where I first met my best friend, and is my go-to community bakery/coffee shop. Every time I go I'm greeted with a smile and a delicious case of pastries. This past visit exceeded all others though, and Maya made my day! They were so incredibly accommodating. Definitely try Sunflour out if you're looking for a friendly atmosphere and a fresh pastry or delicious cup of coffee!

Literally cannot piece together an order. The consistency that they mess up more items than they get correct is simply astonishing. The food is great, when it is made within 2 hours of ordering and it's the correct item(s). The most horribly run place imaginable. Employees are working hard, but clearly something isn't working. Management? Order processing? Who knows. All I know is that if you don't open up your to-go bag in the restaurant and tell them what items you are missing/were made incorrectly, right then and there, then you will get home with EVERYTHING WRONG. If you have a to-go order from here may God be with you and I hope you don't have any serious allergies.

I like their baked goods and their cupcakes, but they are very inconsistent with what they have available. I called in advance to ask what cupcakes they would have the next day and was told to come in the morning but there would be cupcakes available but she couldn't tell me what kind. Here I am at 7:30 in the morning to pick up some cupcakes and there are zero... Disappointing customer service. You can't order on the website, it says to email for a cupcake order. No one ever responded to my order. The website says to click on the link to order cupcakes and that brings you to a page where you can only buy mason jar cake mixes. I guess I just expected more.
The employees are always so friendly and caring. I love Sunflour Baking Company!!

Maa'Ma is getting chemo today. She wanted a cappuccino and an almond croissant. I was tempted by the chicken salad, but only without the onions, as they disagree with me. This was at 8:10AM. By 9AM, Maa'Ma's drink was cold and I was sitting waiting on a sandwich. Only then, over 45 minutes later, was I was told that the onion was an indelible and permanent part of the chicken salad, and, at this point, with my drinks having chilled and Maa'Ma checked in and being prepped for her chemotherapy infusion,  I was asked if I would still like to have the chicken salad sandwich made, or if I'd like a refund for it.

I took the refund for the sandwich. I kept the cold drinks. What was I going to do? Wait another 45 minutes to be asked if I still wanted the drinks?

And to top it off, The berry Charlotte was a unique mixture of sour and bland.

This experience cost $35. Yes, I had tipped at the point of sale.
Good food but very slow. Employees move with little to no urgency and it takes forever to get your food, even if there is not a line.
Nice GF Vegan muffin
DO NOT GIVE THIS PLACE YOUR MONEY. Customer service terrible. Inaccurate orders. Rude staff.

My baked good was fantastic but the service was just ridiculous. Do the employees know they are at a place to work? There were 3 people up front, the guy was the most unhelpful. Having to ask for everything appeared to be a nuisance for him. He would walk away,seeing you look for something, appear to talk about you & if he brought something out would sit on the counter,never look at you or say anything & walk away. You e hit the bottom of the barrel on employees.
Waited 30 minutes for a breakfast sandwich and 15 minutes for an iced latte.
Great customer service and the best pastries I have had in years.

I was looking for an Irish soda bread for St Patrick's Day and couldn't find one. So I googled bakeries and Sunflour came up. I gave them a call and they had  them. So I went down there and saw they did have them. No price was on display so I asked for one. When they rang me up, it came out to $27.07 and was shocked, but I bought it anyway so we would have it for St Pats Day. It was horrible. It was not worth anything near that price. It was hard, dry and had no flavor. Lucky they had raisins in it. That was the only taste it had, other than the butter we had to pile on. They should see what they could do to make it better, maybe go to Ireland and see how there are supposed to be made or not make them at all.

When I tell you this is a must place to stop! EVERYTHING is amazing and you will not be disappointed! The people behind the counter are very welcoming and engaging and ready to answer any questions you may have. I tried the dirty chai, the morning glory muffin and the club and all of them exceeded my expectations! This is a well kept gem in Charlotte and if you are here please stop by!
$7.50 for a BLT with literally a single tomato slice on it (drenched in mayo). Filthy tables, slow service. I think I'd rather go to the Starbucks next door...

Always a pleasure to eat here. The delicious aroma of fresh baked goodness that permeates from the moment you open the door is always inviting. The array of baked goods, sandwiches, desserts and coffee are outstanding and always tasty. It has a comfortable and laid back vibe you can sit and enjoy your treats. Sunflour puts Starbucks to shame. Certified Charlotte awesome eats.

I eat breakfast here like three times a week. Cinnamon roll will literally melt your face off it's so good, the chocolate croissants when they are warm are to die for, and the sandwiches are great and fresh.

The food is absolutely wonderful, definitely a treat always. Isabelle at the counter was amazing and really treated my friend and I so well when we came in. Definitely love this place, the food is always fresh and tasty as well!

Went to Sunflour Baking Company in Charlotte NC around 9:45 AM on a Sunday. I was going to call in my order on DoorDash, but decided to go. They told me there was a delay on the sandwiches, about 20 minutes, but I was fine with that. I ended up waiting 55 minutes. The woman was extremely apologetic and gave me a five dollar coupon. My sandwich was amazing. It was a egg, avocado, ham, and cheese on a cheddar biscuit. I will definitely order again, but would call ahead. I also had the cinnamon roll and it was pretty good.

Because of them, my daughter had her first real birthday cake at her 8th birthday party. She has a lot of allergies, and they were accommodating with the restrictions. She had cake with any reactions to it. And it was beautiful, bigger than we expected and delicious....
Get their cinnamon roll! If you want a good local breakfast sandwich sunflour is the place to go. Typically quick with indoor and outdoor seating.

I bought three cinnamon rolls at Sunflour on 7th street. Worst cinnamon rolls we ever tasted. They didn't taste like the cinnamon rolls we are use to eating. Not worth my $17.05. A waste of my money. Never again will I go there again.

Do yourself a favor and don't order anything but a croissant. Or just don't go at all. I want to like this place and have eaten there several times because of its proximity, but it is consistently bad, especially given the prices, which are steep. I mean bad. Like I can't finish what I ordered because it was so bad. All of their recipes lack salt, are dry, and so not seem fresh. Recipes you would think you can't screw up, like a muffin or cinnamon roll. Also, the table tops were sticky, which is just gross. It's sole redeemer is the croissant, hence the one star.
Unimpressive. Skip it.

My delivery order from here was a disgrace and this review is based solely on the food quality and not a service or dine-in experience.

We ordered two breakfast sandwiches from here yesterday: the avocado toast with bacon and egg added and an egg, cheddar, and avocado sandwich with onions and pesto. Both sandwiches were missing avocado, which is an extra charge, including the AVOCADO TOAST. How does that happen? Not to mention that my $10.50 croissant sandwich was so pathetic and essentially an open face sandwich with one small piece of croissant and a sad portion of egg and cheese smooshed together that I mistook for the other side of the bread. It looks like I ordered an onion and pesto sandwich. The key lime pie was sizable and good.

Seems food quality and poor service are an issue at this location based on other reviews so we definitely will not be wasting money here again.
Fantastic bakery. We love it and will continue to go there often.
They don't have the Vanilla Sugar Roll anymore and it physically hurts, otherwise I love this place so much

Omg! The sunnys special breakfast sandwich is literally the best sandwich ive ever had. I add bacon and cheddar..i have been a weekly buyer for over 2 years with a awesome cup of coffee..when i have a sweet tooth i get the cinnamon  bun..i post thid when i dont review places normally because i feel the need to make sure you dont sleep on them..they are legit

I want to love this place (I really do), but after visiting several times I always leave thinking I overpaid, feeling the service is quite awful, and wishing I went elsewhere.

Sunflour has quite possibly the best muffins in Charlotte, but that's all that would warrant a higher review.  The service leaves a lot to be desired with staff that never seems happy, and wait times that are hard to justify for coffee or baked goods.

The bread used on their sandwiches is always great, but the rest usually lacks flavor and any moisture.  To ensure it's not dry, it would need mustard (a 50 cents add on), or multiple condiments... otherwise, be sure you have water on hand.  I've tried this place for years and unfortunately it has lost its local bakery neighborhood feel as the goal seems to be expansion while compromising on service and taste.

Sunflour is one of my favorite cafes in Charlotte. Their coffee is delightfully smooth every time and their bakery items are huge and delicious!
I tired the Forager breakfast sandwich today and it was excellent. The truffle aioli really came through and paired well with the goat cheese and mushrooms. We also tried an egg and bacon cheddar biscuit, which was also tasty. I think the biscuit itself was the star of the show.
Great place for coffee and breakfast :)
Orders are rarely accurate. Long waits. Disorganized staff.  They have some high quality baked items. But anything else is a mess.

This place is a joke. The food is really good which is why we tried it again. The time that it takes to get the food is ridiculous. We waited 27 minutes from the time we ordered until the time we received the food. For 2 sandwiches. No special order, no changes, just 2 sandwiches.
The dining area is more of a waiting room. Take a look at the number of people with a drink but no food.
Sunflour slow before Covid, really slow during Covid (understandably) but service has gotten slower.
We've tried for years to like this place. The food is good. The service is poor.
Great food! The rosemary bread is great with anything!

Ordered my coffee at 10:58, a simple medium drip coffee, and did not have it until 11:11. There were plenty of people who got their coffees after i had ordered.  I understand a rush, but to pour a drip coffee should take less than 30 seconds.
Just confused. Ordered a Turkey BLT and  I got an email saying it would take aN hour to make. Then when I got it it only had Turkey avocado and the bread. Missing the 3 main things lol. Do better.

The #6 sandwich - egg sausage and tomato pesto was really good (I removed the arugula). Lots of flavor and the cheddar biscuit was really yummy, but a lot of bread. One star less because it took a while to prepare.
I love that this bakery has lots of gf and vegan treats available. So yummy.

Best breakfast burrito in town!

These types of healthy/trendy menus are usually a turn off for me. The wife loves the place, which usually means I won't.

However, to appease her we went here and I was very happy with the breakfast burrito. It's been the best I've had outside of the burritos in Arizona. Enjoyed it so much I forgot to take a picture...

The pastries are worlds better than the much overrated Amelies.

The location on Elizabeth on 7th Street in Charlotte North Carolina is the initial location that I fell in love with and discovered. After many years of turmoil the incorrect front end employees the service has returned to a level that makes it the place that I no longer romanticize but have come to expect as a place to ascertain and achieve excellent artistry food with Superior products and a fantastic vegan selection.
Best bacon egg and cheese croissant!
Great staff, great atmosphere and great coupons!

If you want an overpriced breakfast sandwich made of rubber fake eggs that look like tofu that takes 25 Mins to come out, this is the place for you. Save yourself the time and $ and get better quality at McDonald's..... Cashier lady was nice (blonde girl)
Very average place as far as the desserts go. The staff made it somewhat worse.
Best morning glory muffin

Thank you for the best customer service and for making the chai latte right!!  It's been so long since someone made it right and you guys were on point - made my day. Will totally be back, have a good one~!
We were in town for a bachelorette party & we stopped here for coffee & breakfast sandwiches & WOW. The chicken caprese panini was next level. Friendly staff. Will suggest to anyone in the area.
Great Rosemary Olive Oil Bread, fast service.
Cheddar biscuits are irresistible!

Extremely disappointed in the quality of our food. After a 25 minute wait we received two sorry looking sandwiches not even cut in half. Could've made better at home in not even half the time. The lemonade was good

I have been coming here to the East location  since Day One and the front end staff continue to decline. We don't want to walk in and not get a hello nor a good morning, be happy. Instead we get a sour attitude as if we were bothering them by coming in. I asked for regular white sugar and was told they didn't have any. What, you are a bakery, do I look stupid or is it your laziness, grabbing a ramekin and get a little scoop from the back isntoo much work? In the past, that is what others have done, but nope not this crew. Sad to see this place go down the list of places to stop in and get my weekly items.

The sandwich was soooooo delicious.  They were also very apologetic about giving me the wrong cookie that I paid $3 for. They said that they would refund me for the cookie, but I haven't seen it yet. That's cool though. The sandwich made up for it and their excellent customer service

I would've left a 3 star but the workers are rude. Customer service is as a 4/10 at its best. They look at you with disgust as if they don't want to be at work.

Cinnamon rolls weren't all that. Coffee was decent. Croissants had too much butter.

Definitely won't be coming back.
Kinda high

I really debated coming here after two bad experiences by a bunch of girls who were young and White and I am not racist but this was the case. Today I was gonna go to Amelia's but wanted to stop quickly before getting my kid and thought let me try this place again and what a surprise had done customer service from two beautiful queens she gave me hot coffee and I told her cold had no issue remaking it and had such upbeat attitudes needles to say I will be back but if they ain't there back out the door I go lmbo....

Thanks ladies
Always a solid choice for a quick breakfast bite

Food is good,  service is great... but why do they stop serving breakfast at 11am?  I will not be able to get there before noon on weekends,  so I guess that means we are not coming back for breakfast :(
The coffee is really good. The staff are incredibly friendly and happy and upbeat. Local shop that definitely is a gem. I can't speak on the food but the pastries looked delicious.
This place is great. Can't go wrong between their sandwiches, cookies, and coffee. Their latte might be the best in Charlotte. The overall vibe of the place could be better though.
Layne (sorry if i butchered the spelling) was amazing and recommenced the avocado melt which was amazing! cute pastries too!

Way Way Way too expensive! Got an egg and cheese (only) sandwich on a croissant for $9!!! And the egg was a rectangle egg paty, not even a real egg! Croissant was pretty good but not worth the crazy prices. Carrot cake in a jar was just okay.
total Chaos, likely Cold. Unless they aren't busy, then it's on point.

I entered this business today at 3:51pm to order a sandwich, the cashier asks what I want to order and I say a sandwich, she tells me let me see if sandwiches are open. She talks with someone in the back then comes back and tell me sandwiches are closed, I'm sorry we close in 5 mins. Terrible customer service and I am not sure if it's because I am an African American or what but what business in the business of selling sandwiches and are open closes just that product when your business hours say you close at 4:00pm and your doors are still open? Someone please explain this to me?

Dr. S. Stanley
4:03pm outside of the business in my car!
The food was great and the staff was awesome.
Great breakfast sandwiches, cheddar biscuits, and sweets. Always friendly as well. Great place
Good customer service is EVERYTHING...will not be supporting this business again.
Love this place great food and coffee. Very busy spot. Go early and enjoy the food sbd staff. Very friendly staff and manager.
This little place is Amazing and Quick
Love the gluten free treats. Gotta go early in the week to get them.
Terribly run place, cakes still raw, roaches in kitchen. Under staffed
Visited while in town visiting family and friends. The cheddar biscuits and maple oat scones are amazing. Cinnamon rolls are great but hard to come by because they sell out.
This is the original spot and completely amazing foods.
Best ever  haven't  tasted  breakfast  this good  anywhere in Charlotte  you gotta  give  them a try

Serving bad avocados is not okay. I own a food business myself and I understand the difficulties with avocados, but this is the second time this happens.

I've probably ordered the same sandwich about 6 times. 2 out of the 6 this has happened,hence the not bad rating, but one time it happened with friends I had hyped up about your business.

I can't share your business with other people because the quality is not consistent. Something in your operations needs a closer look.

All that being said, I really hope it gets better since I love your #3 on cheddar biscuit.
The white girl at the front needs to do a better job at acknowledging incoming customers. I literally stood there for 2 mins, with her not providing any assistance

I'm sorry but my experience at this sunflour wasn't pleasant  I waited 35 minutes for a egg sandwich, the young man at the counter did offer me a muffin.
I like the one on Mallard better  sorry
1st. time in bakery, and not as impressed as I thought I would be. Small selection of goodies.

This place can get really busy, especially in the morning, but for good reason. They have a great breakfast sandwiches, especially if you get the cheddar biscuit! Can't recommend it enough, it is humongous, filling and full of flavor.
Great cinnamon rolls and cheddar biscuits!

I'm a doordasher, so I'm talking to my fellow dashers. If you ever come to this restaurant just know you will be treated rudely. This is my second time coming to this restaurant and have been disappointed and disrespected. When things go wrong on DoorDash end the employees just expect for you to know everything and not ask questions. She literally told me she called and canceled, I don't have nothing to give you and throw her hands up. I will never take another delivery from this location. The tone and attitude was not calls for. If you knew the customer couldn't get in contact with DoorDash. The restaurant it self should have contacted DoorDash to keep down the confusion and disrespect.
Friendly staff, great coffee, and their sandwiches are always out of this world. I tried the GF mini cake donut today - highly recommend!!

Very nice aesthetically pleasing cafe. They serve more than just fresh brewed coffee, but wonderfully baked bread and baked goods. The workers were very nice and professional. I simply cannot understand the negative reviews, but I suppose some people are just looking to complain. All in all, I look forward to returning to eat here.
Ordered DD and they left off a whole order, when I called the store Courtney went above and beyond to make sure we got our order delivered, and was super sweet and helpful. The food is phenomenal!

The #6 breakfast sandwich on a cheddar biscuit was OUT OF THIS WORLD delicious! Everyone seemed really nice. My mom also loved her croissant and blueberry muffin, which she said were some of the best she's ever had.

Only four stars because the coffees weren't that good. But still worth a visit for the food alone!

I gave it 2 chances but I'll never go back. The staff is cold and unwelcoming. No one smiles. Both times, it took forever for someone to take my order. Each time, I was on the verge of walking out. I get the impression the staff does not like working there. The breakfast sandwiches are over priced for what they are. Sliced over toasted bread. No seasoning on the eggs which aren't even fresh cracked. Tastes like McDonald's folded egg. I needed ketchup, hot sauce, AND bbq sauce to eat it. I'm from NYC where a baconeggandcheese (yes, one word) is considered to be the breakfast of champions. I could never stop here before going to the office!
Great  Food & Service Highly Recommended
Tasty breakfast sandwiches.
I puchased 2 chocolate/chocolate cookies. To my surprise, there is salt on top of one cookie. I'm not an extra salt eater. Very disappointed.

I was just in sunflower and the lady was very short with us and was not the nicest lady, she seemed like she didn't want to be there and my friend went in 1 minute after they closed to get some water because she was really dehydrated and the lady snapped at her and said we're closed in a very snappy way and we sat outside since they were closed and she came outside 2 mins later and said I'm going to need that table in a mean tone. I've always loved sunflower and I go there all the time and they are always so nice and kind there so I don't know why she was so snappy with us.

Good food and coffee, but the absolute slowest service! I want to come here, to a local business, so much more than the Starbucks down the street, but they make it very difficult especially when I just want to grab a quick coffee on my way to work. The most frustrating part is they'll have multiple people behind the counter, but only one person doing coffee and that's what everyone is waiting on.

Great food and baked goods.
Unfriendly attitude from behind the counter.
Please, thank you, and you're welcome go along way in a service industry position.
Especially since masks hide facial expressions.
The food is good but like other reviews have mentioned, it takes forever to get your order whether you order in the store or ahead online for pick-up.
The vanilla cheesecake was yummy!

We've always loved coming to Sunflour - they have the best BLT on their cheddar biscuits. Because of the slow service however, we hadn't been in quite some time. We decided to try it again this past weekend and placed an online order for 4 sandwiches. After the order was confirmed, it said it would be ready at 10:15. We arrived a few minutes late at 10:20, expecting it to be ready but it was not. I stood by the prepaid order pick up without being acknowledged for over 5 minutes while workers were just pidding around. After finally getting the attention of someone, I was told our order was not ready and it would be up next. Fast forward 15 more minutes and it was still not ready. In total, our 10:15 order wasn't ready until 10:50 which is beyond acceptable. To make things worse we got home and they were prepared incorrectly. Sadly, we will likely not be visiting this location again due to the poor service.
Great service. Excellent pastries and croissants. Best in all of Charlotte.

The food is great but the service is just terrible and it takes forever. I had written this place off for this reason for the last 6 months. I gave it one last shot today. Took me 20 minutes to get an iced tea that takes 5 minutes to steep. When I went in for the second time to see what was going on I was told they were out of ice so they were trying to cool it down in the freezer. bizarre.
Would not recommend this bakery. Food is served cold, staff is unfriendly and you definitely do not get what you are paying for.
Good pastry Good cappuccino Friendly staff.

The panini sandwiches were amazing!
We had avocado melt , but without avocado, we substituted tuna. We are definitely looking forward to trying the pastries next time!
The staff , especially the manager, was professional and very attentive to our needs, even at the end of their busy day.
We appreciate you!
Great place to grab a cappuccino and a  Croissant. Service was fast and professional. Give it a try.

I like coming for the pastries but they are very disorganized and are never open at time. When you say you open at 7:00, I should be able to walk in at 7:00. Not seeing you guys get yourselves together with the doors locked. Very disrespectful of customers' time
Their croissant is out of this world!
Great spot for a quick bakery bite and Pure intentions coffee!
Their breakfast sandwiches are always so good. Love their coffee as well.

Yesterday was the first time my husband and I went to this bakery. I purchased the  Carrot Oat Muffin, I loved it. My husband purchased 2 Croissants, and 2 round crunchy rolls to take home. He definitely liked the Croissants and rolls and would definitely buy they again.
Great experience
Delicioso...
Always delicious

I don't normally leave reviews. But I had to. This is my first time ordering from Sunflour- I ordered the grilled cheese with tomato cheddar and provolone. And added avocado and egg. The egg is microwaved egg - which for a company, microwaving eggs is the Dunkin' Donuts way of serving quick and disgusting breakfast. There was no tomato in my sandwich and the cheddar cheese was barely melted. I rated a 2 because minus the eggs - which I had to remove and paid an extra $1 for- the sandwich still tasted ok. Just not up to par with what I expected and definitely not worth the price I paid.

Honestly, get anything from here. You will not be disappointed. I love to come for breakfast, to grab a loaf of homemade rosemary sourdough sliced bread, & any treat. Today, I got the sweet potato meringue. Heaven.
Look, the food is good. But I had a pre-arranged pickup time and still had to wait 40 minutes. Very, very dissatisfied.

Y'all....the pastries at Sunflour Baking Company are amazing!!! My favorite is the cinnamon role. They are huge and the frosting is delicious!!!

Update: I have removed a star because there are never any pastries ready at 7am when they open, despite customers already lining up at the door. I so often leave empty handed or with a day old stale pastry from the back because they aren't prepared at opening.
Good pastries

Nice menu. A little pricey but all is fresh and good! Had some bakery items (several over a few days) and all were great. My date had the tuna sandwich and I had the grilled cheese with tomato. It was all very good. We will be back.
Of course the bread the best think you could get from here! Everything taste fresh and light!

Love this place. Always great customer service. Besides their amazing treats in the displays I have ordered a few vegan cakes and they were soooooo delicious! Consistently perfect every time. Thank you for making my families birthdays extra special!
The food is always soooo good!

Very nice and comfy place for coffee and bakery.
I ordered few sandwiches  and apple turnover.
OMG!! Tasty!!!

I normally like Sunflour, but this past order really turned me off. #1 left out dessert. #2 BLT was old: extremely soggy tomato, old bacon. I had to spit it out and couldn't finish it because the old soggy tomato had soaked into the rest of the sandwich. The BLTs are usually excellent, but this has turned my stomach. surely the person that created it knew they were using a soggy old tomato. Update 2 mins later: Coffee DEFINITELY old too. Can't drink it
ONCE U GO HERE..YOU WILL ALWAYS COME BACK!! FRIENDLY GREAT SERVICE!! MY CHILDREN ARE HOOKED!! BEST BAKERY!!

I've eaten here for years and it's always good. I love the avocado melt (avocado, spinach, pesto, tomato, and goat cheese) and the banana chocolate chip muffin is perfect! Their bread is also really good; I love the sourdough. They carry coffee from Pure Intentions, a Charlotte based roaster, and sell bags of it for you to make at home! They also have cake jars that you can ship to friends and family across the US.
Fantastic bakery tastiest.

Most importantly, I received excellent service. Ordered a blueberry filled croissant, FANTASTIC! Over several visits, the quality of their baked goods has been consistent and of high standard. Simply put, great baked items and great service. They also have a good variety of teas and coffee.
Cute place. Not very friendly but efficient. Good cookies. Very clean.
Great food plenty of healthy choices
The breads for the breakfast sandwiches are amazing! The rest of the sandwich is okay but the bread elevates it to another level.
Fantastic

I have been to this location several times and the food and service has always been great. But our visit on 8/22/20 at around 12:30 pm the woman who was presumably the manager on duty was extremely rude. I waited over 30 minutes for an iced mocha, people who had come in after me were getting their food before I even got my drink. My sister got her drink within 2 minutes of ordering but mine never came. When I attempted to explain this to her several times (at least 3) she kept cutting me off and asking me if I had gotten my "latte" which I had never ordered. But instead of waiting 5 second for me to finish my sentence she was brash, and cut me off several times like I didn't know what I was talking about. She also treated several other customers this way. Everyone else there was very kind and the girl working the drink station apologized profusely even though it wasn't her fault. But the managers attitude was very off putting and not representative of what I have come to know sunflour bakery to be. If I was rating just off her attitude it would be one star. I only added an additional one due to the kindness of the other staff members.

This place was so-so. The coffee was cold and it was the last cup they were making so they didn't replace it, however they did offer us free pastries after the fact to compensate, which was nice of them.
The food was unique and very tasty. I tried the avocado Panini, with goat cheese and roasted tomatoes.
I loved their breakfast sandwich on their croissant!
The breakfast sandwiches and cinnamon rolls are fantastic!
Phenomenal place to eat breakfast! I had an egg, bacon, and cheddar sandwich on an English muffin and loved it!
Baked goods and sandwiches here are top notch .  Egg Avocado Cheese, chocolate chip banana muffins!

The food here is great, a nice selection of paninis, baked goods and desserts, priced fairly! coffee is great, $1.75 for a small drip and its very smooth and the beans are roasted just right.

interior is always clean and service is great.

This was my first time ordering a breakfast sandwich here and I ordered it for pickup. The egg was fake egg in a square on barely toasted, non buttered bread. Had the topping listed on it, cheese, cold tomato, cold spinach, and provolone. For the price, I will not be ordering a breakfast sandwich from there again.

The order online and pick up process needs to be improved, I waited in line with no direction or update from who was working. Myself and others were very confused what we were supposed to be doing if we ordered online. I saw my food sitting on the back counter and had to get someone's attention and let them know I was there to pick up an online order.
they do not prepare the order quickly
Always delicious. Upscale bakery, gluten free and vegan options. Never disappointed.

Inefficient counter because you order and pay at register.  If you order over phone and don't pay,  fully expect to have to wait in line 15-20mins to just get to counter.  Unless you pay over phone you wait in same line.  Disappointed as food And pastries are generally good.
food was great! but, the Danish was thrown upside down in the bag. all filling was in the bottom of the bag. Muffins just thrown in upside down as well. Should have done better.
This was a nice little find while we were looking for somewhere to get breakfast. Nice breakfast sandwiches and pastries. They're put together fresh so allow yourself a little time.
Excellent customer service!
Best if you want eggless cake in charlotte.. but you need to order before 3-4 days..
The berry croissant was amazing!
Got 3 desserts and a coffee and the girl at the cash register was very sweet. Thanks for being nice. Clean rr and dining area. Will revist.

Sunflour in Elizabeth is such a kind and inviting environment, and they have great treats too! The staff are always friendly, and I once witnessed them give a meal to a man in need, while treating him with such kindness and dignity. Shout out also to the new guy with glasses, such great attention to detail!

The cinnamon rolls and chocolate croissants are the best I have ever had!

ALSO, great gluten free vegan options!
Delicous!
Best croissants in the United States. Some foodie magazine needs to catch wind of this superbly unassuming bakery.

I have been going to Sunflour bakery since it opened, and I live in the Elisabeth neighborhood. I will not be going to this establishment anymore. The employees often get my order wrong, and have a general bad attitude. They NEVER have cinnamon rolls when I come in to order, which is usually late morning. For how expensive their prices are, I expected a bit more.
Great breakfast sandwiches, love their sourdough but the other breads are nice as well. Definitely worth stopping in for breakfast when I'm in the area.
Great coffee and pastries! Breakfast sandwiches are awesome and the poptart is phenomenal! So good worth the wait!
Notting at this store.
Fantastic Chedder biscuit breakfast sandwiches...and to die for French press coffee!! A regular stop.
This place is good but busy on the weekends  get there  early
Really tasty and great staff
The croissant was okay but the coffee was really bad.
Omg so freaking good! Had an egg and cheese on a cheddar biscuit the size of my head! It was so crispy on the outside and perfect. Cant wait to try everything on the menu :p

BEST gluten-free muffins ever! My mom is a life-long baker who unfortunately has to now eat gluten-free. She has tried baking muffins but nothing compares to Sunflour's! I LOVE the cheddar biscuits, vegan banana chocolate chip muffins and chocolate chip scones. Mom is getting a gluten-free cake this week for her birthday: there are so many choices it will be difficult to decide! Our only complaint: items are so popular (esp the GF items), they are frequently sold-out.
Underwhelmed by the limit of gluten free items. Nice little cafe but left me wanting more.
Great as always. No keylime pie today though
Good food. Needs more seating.

I want to love this place. So many options and the pastries are delicious. I always end up waiting forever for my latte, and usually somehow it gets messed up. Wrong milk, flavor, size. It's always something with the coffee or food. Pastries are great and some amazing vegan options. I have ordered a cake through them once, and it was perfect.

One of my favorite breakfast spots, I prefer the East Blvd location because their cheddar biscuits are always more fresh and fluffy. One of my favorite sandwiches in Charlottes is their Bacon, egg, cheese, with avacado.

A great bakery and coffee place that seems to be on the hip side.  This is a cozy place where you can get some studying or computer work done as well.  The staff here is great also.  I will say that the parking situation in this area could improve.  Maybe they could build and underground parking area or something....

waited 25 minutes after placing an order for a sandwich only to realize that they never put in the order. but not only was i waiting, there were at least 5 other people waiting who's food had not even been started on. i walked around the side to see the cook on his phone
Average. A tad pretentious.
They have breakfast sandwiches, and very cool vibe. I liked my experience here.
Great pastries and coffee concoctions.
Loved the avocado melt grilled panini and fresh lemonade.  The staff was very friendly and helpful with suggestions and tailoring our food to us.
A fine bakery!
Real tasty treats and coffee.
Our sandwiches were excellent.  I highly recommend the Rosemary bread.
Great sandwiches, pastries, and coffee.
Very very very good croissants
Great coffee and muffins
Yummy sourdough bread!
Great meeting place . Spacious, super fresh food and helpful staff.
Highly recommend any of the breakfast sandwiches on the cheddar biscuit. The giant iced cinnamon rolls are phenomenal (perfect gooey center) and pair nicely with a dirty mocha! We will be back.
Been coming here since the beginning and always enjoyed the experience and the food. But today it was untidy, dirty and in disarray. Looks like they're going out of business.
I mean, look at this Cinnamon Roll!!
Cinnamon roll tasted weird and stale
Way overpriced, service was rude.
Great breads, staff could use some work following the instructions left for them, but always nice!
#4 on a cheddar biscuit is my favorite
Delicious quick bites, healthy and fresh!
Great friendly service. We had the almond Joy cheesecake and the buckeye brownie. Both were amazing. Can't wait to go back and try more from their menu.
Amazing baked goods, tremendous cheddar biscuits. Can't wait to go back and try some lunch sandwiches. Cinnamon rolls are huge, croissants as well. Something for everyone!

Had breakfast sandwiches which sounded good, looked good, but the sheet pan eggs cut square were col and the cheese was half melted, but cold. The bread was only warm because it had come out of panini press.
Great coffee and sandwiches! I always get a mocha and a turkey avocado bacon (TAB) sandwich on rosemary bread. Yum!
Pleasant restaurant with a unique menu.  Excellent staff and the food was good.  Good restaurant to give a try. Parking is limited.

Very hard to get in and out of parking lot.  In fact it is dangerous.  Staff cannot answer questions about products.  Young high school staff only trained to ring up and not answer customer questions.

The Service sucks in this place. I think the girl with red hair was having a bad day or something?
I had the carrot muffin it was just ok and my latte a bit weak.
Will not come back to this place or recommend anyone.
I love Sunflower! Their muffins are so perfect, I love Blueberry or Lemon Poppyseed, I love their breakfast sandwiches, and I always get a Tumeric-Ginger Chai
